terms.definition: Foundational Community Supports - Targeted Apple Health (Medicaid) benefits to assist eligible individuals with complex health needs obtain and maintain stable housing and employment.

Third-Party Administrator - Wellpoint serves as the single TPA contracting with Washington Health Care Authority for the FCS program, facilitating implementation, enhancing quality, supporting providers and paying claims.
Community Support Services - Services that support individuals with their ability to prepare for and transition to housing, and maintaining tenancy once housing is secured.
Individual Placement and Support - Evidence-based supported employment services that help eligible individuals obtain and maintain stable competitive employment in integrated community settings.
Billing code for Supportive Housing services, per diem, with a rate of $112 per day and benefit limitation of 30 days over a 180-day period.
Billing code for Pre-employment services - supported employment activities that assist an individual with obtaining employment, billed per 15-minute unit at $27 per unit.
Billing code for Employment-sustaining services - ongoing supports to maintain employment, billed per 15-minute unit at $27 per unit.
Home- and Community-Based Services - Services intended to help Apple Health beneficiaries with complex health needs transition to and maintain community-based housing and employment resources.
A request for payment that is submitted on time, accurate, on a HIPAA-compliant form, requires no further information to be processed, and is not under investigation for fraud.
Exception to Rule/Limited Extension Request - A request for additional supported employment or supportive housing units above the initial authorized amount when clinically necessary.
Description, Assessment, Response, Plan - A commonly used template for documenting enrollee interactions in progress notes containing all required elements for effective documentation.
Goals that are Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, and Time-Bound - required format for treatment plan goals.
CSS activities including functional needs assessments, housing preference identification, assistance with applications, budgeting support, and developing individualized community integration plans.
CSS activities that help individuals maintain housing including service planning, care coordination, entitlement assistance, independent living skills development, and landlord communication support.
As defined by U.S. Housing and Urban Development (HUD), includes individuals who previously met HUD's definition but have been housed in the last 60 days.
Activities of Daily Living - Basic self-care tasks; needing assistance with three or more ADLs is one health needs-based criteria for FCS eligibility.
Predictive Risk Intelligence System score - A score of 1.5 or above qualifies as a risk factor for Supportive Housing eligibility.
Employment paying at least minimum wage, where employees perform the same work as others without disabilities, in community settings, not reserved for people with disabilities.
IPS principle that every covered person who wants to work is eligible regardless of diagnosis, symptoms, work history, substance abuse, or cognitive impairment.
Transition Assistance Program - Time-limited, flexible funding assistance for FCS-SH enrollees covering housing-related fees, move-in costs, and non-refundable fees.
Apple Health and Homes Rental Assistance Program - Connects supportive housing services with rental assistance through tenant-based vouchers.
Wellpoint's exclusive partner for managing Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) transactions and electronic claims submission. Payer ID: WLPNT.
The requirement to submit claims within 365 calendar days of the date of service.
Enrollee-driven planning approach where service/care plans reflect enrollee needs, choices, strengths and goals, with evidence of enrollee authorship.
Work performed on behalf of an enrollee including external care coordination, housing search, landlord engagement, and employer outreach.
Working with enrollee and employer to modify an existing job description to contain some but not all tasks when an applicant cannot perform all duties.
Helping enrollees understand how employment income impacts government benefits like Social Security and Medicaid to make informed decisions about work.
Time-unlimited, individualized employment support provided as long as the enrollee wants and needs it, with the goal of increasing independence.
Events that must be reported to Wellpoint on the same business day of occurrence or provider awareness.
Assessment measuring whether a program operates according to standardized practices using objective rating systems to determine adherence to established models.
Special Investigations Unit - Reviews all reports of provider or member fraud, waste and abuse. Fraud hotline: 866-847-8247.
Claims paid in error that must be returned within 60 calendar days of identification to avoid False Claims Act liability.
First step in provider payment dispute process - initial request to investigate the outcome of a finalized claim, must be filed within 24 months.
National Provider Identifier - Type 2 organization NPI required for FCS provider contracting.
Medicaid ID number assigned by Washington State Health Care Authority required for FCS provider enrollment.
Certified Employment Support Professional - Certification by the Employment Support Professional Certification Council acceptable for supported employment staff.
Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities - Accreditation in Employment Services meets supported employment provider requirements.
Valid reasons for delayed claim filing including administrative errors, incorrect enrollee information, unavoidable delays in documentation, or circumstances beyond provider control.
Electronic Remittance Advice - Electronic data interchange transaction (X12 835) providing explanation of payment for claims.
Electronic Funds Transfer - Secure method to receive claim payments directly to provider's bank account using automated clearinghouse network.
Homeless Management Information System - Database that may contain documentation to validate health needs or risk factors for FCS eligibility.
Fair Market Rent - TAP monthly rent must be under 120% FMR; AHAH-RAP covers up to 130% FMR.
Form confirming Wellpoint authorization for services required for specific episode of care, must accompany ETR requests.
Process where providers must submit medical records with each claim for SIU review when identified as outliers or for unusual billing practices.
180-day timeframe during which FCS services are authorized; can be renewed if enrollee continues to meet eligibility criteria.
